title: Kog'Maw dropped to a 46% win rate after Revert
body: Aaaaaaye all you people trolling me with my posts about how he doesn't function well with the revert.  What say you now? The champion has no good build path, low dmg, can't reach max AS, Can't exceed 50% crit without giving entirely up on defensive items entirely, and cannot reach high AD ratios, and cannot build any pen whatsoever.  Kog is in a terrible state without any compensation after the revert.

replies.body: People are a) also relearning how to play him, and b) Riot mentioned they were going to keep close tabs on him for a while.

No one is learning how to play him. Everyone knows how to play him and understands the ONLY build path available for him.  The game has changed too much for the old Kog to work.  All of his items have been nerfed since the days of the "reverted" Kog doing well.  The meta has changed, Adc's received compensation for the changing meta to allow them to function better.  Revert Caitlyn and see how well she performs in this meta?  Revert MF and see how well she performs in this meta, revert Trist and see how well she performs in this meta.  See where I'm going with this?  Revert any changed ADC and see how well they do in this meta.  Kog got no compensation for the revert.  Only left with is useless ult along with the loss of crit on TrinForce to make it even a harder early game for Kog.  

I'm not qqing, I am bringing light to this because I see absolutely no workings in the PBE for Kog.  It is blatantly obvious how grossly under performing he is and feels. 

I was waiting for a little bump for Yorik because he is lacking a few blatant things as well, yet nothing in the works on the PBE.

He's back to being a late game oriented champion, if you bothered, you'd see his winrate increases with game length. Topping off at 52%, and this number will only go higher with the next several patches, basically he's back to being Kog'Maw.

Agreed. They threw old Kog back into a heavily snowbally meta with people stacking tons of flat armor pen which means Kog is free kills early and mid. He's too risky of a pick to justify taking him for a late game that almost never is going to happen. His build path has been nerfed and for some reason they didnt change his W mana cost back to 0. So its not really even a revert because he still has a nerfed Ult and a nerfed W.

Everyone remembers that W costed no mana

No-one remembers that:
Q costed 60 mana, instead of 40
Q had a shorter range
Q gave 5% less attack speed at all levels
Q gave 8% less armor and MR shred at all levels

I'm talking about how Kog was back at 5.22 in comparison to now, since the revert is of the 5.22 W mechanic changes. Not as far back as Season 4.

Also, when Q was targeted:
Q costed 50 mana - 60 mana at 5.22
Q had 625 range - instead of 975 at 5.22
Q gave flat pen - instead of percentage shred
Q did less damage

Other abilities probably had some minor changes as well.

Oh they increased the range of the skillshot Q with the rework?
I really did not know that.
I also acknowledge that  Q was far worse back then (the range was so short it could hardly ever be used).
He's still really strong, it's just he onky does well late game, and in that case it's almost safer to just play Tristana

But he isn't really strong.  The only thing he is strong against is dmging a beefy hp tank who is ignoring him and allowing him to stand there and free auto him.  Of which goes for every single ADC you can name.  Only Kog deals lower amounts of dmg and burst to important targets that need to die, coupled with zero mobility.

Makes plenty of sense.
People have to find new build paths to go with now, it's only natural people will play him badly. 
It's the same as any new champion having a low winrate.
It'll just take some time to get used to the new W.  
You're obviously very (Understandably?) butthurt, but it's not like Riot isn't going to adjust him further. 
Just be patient.
There is no good build path with him.  Don't talk about, try it out, see for yourself.

I have been playing him?
He's definitely in a weak spot, but it's not like Riot is just going leave him.
He builds well with BORK imo.

Good.

EDIT: Actually, since the last time Kog had his old kit his core item {{item:3078}} has been changed pretty substantially. Just depends on whether it's better or worse on him now.

Kog'maw always had a lower end win rate, thats because he's a much harder adc to pull off.
With no real peel abilities, and a very end game reliant kit, he's not your normal go to adc, he needs dedication from him and his team.

These numbers arent surprising add the fact that some new people are getting used back to old kog, it's natural his winrate took a hit.

However that doesnt mean other parts of his kit shouldn't be looked at, his ult got a massive nerf from a poke ability to a very weak finisher that has way too much cooldown on his mana gate.
His abilities cost too much mana and he HAS to buy mana/regan unless he wants to back all the time.
These are areas that can be looked at with current state kog'maw.
